DOC.brief_summary: The investigator hypothesize 3 month course vitamin D supplementation treat 25 ( OH ) D deficiency stone former high level 24-hour urinary calcium increase urinary calcium excretion great 10 % .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Vitamin D Urinary Calcium Excretion Kidney Stone Formers With High Urinary Calcium
DOC.detailed_description: We plan conduct clinic-based interventional study 30 patient follow Brigham Women 's Hospital history nephrolithiasis , urinary calcium excretion 200 400 mg/day , 25-vitamin D deficiency ( defined serum level ≤ 25ng/ml ) . The intervention oral ergocalciferol 50,000 IU per week 8 week [ 1 ] , participant serve control . The outcome change urinary calcium excretion . The plan study duration 3 month . We great 95 % power detect 10 % increase 24-hour urinary calcium
DOC.criteria: History nephrolithiasis 25 ( OH ) D deficiency ( defined serum level ≤ 25ng/ml ) within 3 month enrollment 24hour urinary calcium excretion > 199 mg/day < 400 mg/day ( measure less 6 month prior study enrollment ) NonCaucasian Women childbearing age ( age < 50 ) Known uric acid , cystine , struvite stone disease Hypercalcemia ( serum calcium > 10.4 mg/dl within past 12 month ) Gross hematuria within past 6 month Acute stone event within past 2 month Recent stone intervention within past 1 month Suspected known secondary cause hypercalciuria primary hyperparathyroidism , sarcoidosis , hyperthyroidism , malignancy ( except nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Addition dose change medicine potentially affect urinary calcium since enrollment 24hour urine collection ( include diuretic , magnesium supplement , potassium supplement , potassium citrate , vitamin D supplementation )
